title: Gifts received by L.A. Mayor Karen Bass

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Gifts received by L.A. Mayor Karen Bass
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic spreadsheet listing all gifts received by Mayor Karen Bass.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: FOIL Request for Documents Related to the Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Documents Related to the Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to documents related to the Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework (CRSEF) recently released by the New York State Education Department. Specifically, I am requesting the following documents:

1. All communications between the New York State Education Department and any third/outside parties related to the creation, verification, and collection of source material for the CRSEF.
2. All communications between the New York State Education Department and any members of the CRSEF team and writers related to the creation, verification, and collection of source material for the CRSEF.
3. Any interim work product related to the genesis of the CRSEF project, including scoping out key themes and the nine key areas identified in the report.
4. Any data or documents related to the funding and establishment of the CRSEF team and writers.
5. Any and all emails, memoranda, letters, notes, reports, and other documents referencing or discussing the CRSEF or any of its themes or recommendations.


In light of the recent proposed legislation S1402, which would require public schools to be aligned to this document, I respectfully request that this request be handled with urgency and that any responsive documents be provided as soon as possible, if there are any delays it is ok to produce documents on a rolling release schedule.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL: Archive of all Twitter Direct Messages, Muted Accounts and Blocked Accounts

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Archive of all Twitter Direct Messages, Muted Accounts and Blocked Accounts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to the archive of all Twitter Direct Messages, Muted Accounts, and Blocked Accounts for district Twitter accounts. I have attached a screenshot detailing the process for exporting this public information.

To obtain this information, please go to https://twitter.com/settings/account, click on "Your Account", and then click on "Download an Archive of your data". If possible, I would appreciate receiving the entire archive to avoid burdening the district. Alternatively, please provide only the information noted above.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails to or from the following email address since 10/1/2019:

CovidVaccineRedistribution@health.ny.gov

Including any attachments or related forms transmitted as attachments or embedded in responsive email messages.

You can limit your scope only to organizations and transfers within the counties of Schenectady, Rensselear, Albany, and Saratoga.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Jackson Parker

title: FOIA: OIP Opinions regarding CPB and PBS

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA: OIP Opinions regarding CPB and PBS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, I am writing to request any advisory opinions or other guidance issued by the Office of Information Policy (OIP) related to the applicability of FOIA to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting (CPB) or Public Broadcasting Service (PBS).

In particular, I am seeking any OIP guidance or opinions that may provide insight into whether CPB and/or PBS are subject to FOIA, and if so, how FOIA requests to these entities should be handled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: DoS/ Oversight and Codes

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: DoS/ Oversight and Codes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

title: Center for Naval Analyses - Implicit Bias Training

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Center for Naval Analyses - Implicit Bias Training
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, etc.) regarding the Managing Bias Training pilot program held in January of 2023 in partnership with  the Park Ridge police department & the Center for Naval Analyses. Please include 

-emails between the Des Plaines police department and the Center for Naval Analyses, the Park Ridge police department, and any community members. Please include any email attachments.
-any training materials used during the event, including PowerPoint slides, handouts, and other materials provided to attendees.
-names of training attendees.
-any reports or evaluations produced as a result of the training event, including any feedback or assessment provided by participants/facilitators.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Northwestside Coalition

title: Use of force records for 4 facilities, February 2023

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Use of force records for 4 facilities, February 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records for all incidents that involved uses of force on inmates, occurring in February 2023, for the following facilities: 
California Medical Facility (CMF)
Central California Women’s Facility (CCWF) 
High Desert State Prison (HDSP) 
North Kern State Prison (NKSP) 

Please provide the following records for these incidents:

1. Incident report forms (CDCR 837 Crime/Incident Report Forms)
2. Incidents involving use of force on inmates that were documented in the Incident Report Tracking (IRT) system in the Department’s electronic database rather than using CDCR 837 Forms.
3. All use of force review forms (CDCR Form 3010 Incident Commander's Review/Critique Use of Force Incidents). 

When applicable, please provide any tabular data in machine readable format (e.g. csv, Excel, or similar file format).

If you would like to discuss this request, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, American Friends Service Committee, at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with be davis.

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado Ped Patrol
communications.communication:
Dear PCND:

We are writing in response to your Colorado Open Records Act request.
Pursuant to C.R.S. § 39-21-113 (4) (a) the Department "...shall not divulge
or make known in any way any information obtained...or disclosed in any
document, report or return filed in connection with any of the taxes
covered by this
article." Accordingly, information regarding  tax accounts, if any, is not
available in response to a CORA request.

If you have a request for tax information regarding a specific account that
you are the  account owner or authorized representative for, you can
contact the Taxpayer Services Department by calling (303) 238-SERV (7378)
Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm.
Regards,
Patrick Harton

*CORA Manager*
[image: co_dor_edo_rgb_Email_Sig.png (400Ã—77)]
www.colorado.gov/revenue/cora
